result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinshawn E Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
*8/2/2015 Court found further review is not needed.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
*8/21/2016  Honorable Rebecca F. Dallet-Remaining condition time STAYED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quinshawn E Reid

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months0 .
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/15/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM001213  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-11-15

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: AUDRIANNA R ( DOB: 11/26/1993); LAMARE A ( DOB: 2/22/1964). 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Quinshawn E Reid in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
